Header: OPEC meeting ends with no details on cuts
Content: Oil producers led by Saudi Arabia and Russia agreed to cut output by an extra 500,000 barrels a day in the first quarter of 2020, but stopped short of pledging action beyond March. The countries involved pump over 40% of the worldâ€™s oil, and their new combined cuts amount to 1.7 million bpd or 1.7% of global production. A panel of energy ministers representing the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries and non-OPEC producers led by Russia recommended the deeper cut.
